meanings.definition: A railing placed alongside a road or path to prevent vehicles from veering off the edge.
meanings.sent1: The guardrail along the highway kept the cars safe from going off the road.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers installed a new guardrail on the dangerous curve.
meanings.sent3: The guardrail joked with the road signs about their important roles in traffic safety.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a guardrail, guiding him away from making a wrong decision.
meanings.sent5: The bright red guardrail stood out against the green trees, a beacon of safety.

meanings.definition: A barrier used to protect people from falling off a raised platform or edge.
meanings.sent1: The guardrail on the bridge prevented anyone from accidentally falling into the river below.
meanings.sent2: The guardrail around the observation deck offered stunning views of the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The guardrail and the safety net below had a friendly competition on who could catch more falling objects.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was a guardrail, keeping her from falling into despair.
meanings.sent5: The guardrail gleamed in the sunlight, a silent protector of those walking by.
